revised_title: Uncommon Observations on Morbid Bodies and Prune-Stone Ingestion
tldr: The author, Henry Vaughan, shares two medical case studies involving dissections of morbid bodies. In the first case, a man who consumed excessive prunes experienced prune-stone perforation in the intestinum rectum, leading to his death. In the second case, a 14-year-old boy with iliac passion was treated and later dissected to understand the cause of his death. These case studies provide insights into the effects of prune consumption and the importance of dissection in understanding medical conditions.
